intro: Luxemburgia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf luxemburgia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for shade gardens and woodland plantings.
